meanings.definition: A person who enjoins or commands.
meanings.sent1: The enjoiners in the army give orders to the soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The enjoiners at the meeting directed everyone to follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: The enjoiners in the play were the characters with the most authority.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the enjoiners were like the kings on a chessboard, moving others around.
meanings.sent5: The enjoiners in the story were portrayed as wise leaders.

meanings.definition: The act of enjoining or commanding.
meanings.sent1: Following the enjoiners of the boss, the team completed the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The enjoiners of the judge were to be obeyed without question in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The enjoiners of the teacher made the students giggle with their seriousness.
meanings.sent4: The enjoiners of the law were like invisible hands guiding society.
meanings.sent5: The enjoiners of the coach motivated the team to give their best effort.
